bug.author: martmull
bug.summary: Encountering issue to pull private docker image from Dockerhub
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h3>Unclear documentation</denchmark-h>
Hello, Polyaxon is working fine when It pulls a public docker image stored on Dockerhub. However, it fails when it tries to pull it from a private repository on Dockerhub. I followed <denchmark-link:https://github.com/polyaxon/polyaxon/blob/master/docs/configuration/private-registries.md>this documentation</denchmark-link> and I reinstalled Polyaxon adding the Dockerhub credentials in the file such as: privateRegistries: - host: "https://registry-1.docker.io/v2/" user: "<USER_ID>" password: "<PASSWORD>" but I can't make it work. It shows me this error: <denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/29927851/55164677-61c30780-516c-11e9-8930-cbda39806411.png></denchmark-link>
I also tried using this registry "<denchmark-link:https://index.docker.io/v1/>https://index.docker.io/v1/</denchmark-link> ", with and without the protocol, I always encounter the same issue. Do you have any idea why Polyaxon cannot access the private docker image? Or am I missing something? Thank you very much, and by the way, Polyaxon is awesome!
